Package shoppingProject

Class Shopping

java.lang.Object
shoppingProject.Shopping
public class Shopping
extends java.lang.Object
This class creates a ShoppingBag instance for the user and accepts commands which manipulate it. If the commands are incorrect, an error message is displayed. If the commands are recognized, then either the bag's add(). remove(), quit(), display() or checkout() method is called.
Author:
Graham Deubner, Sandeep Alankar

    • getInputs

      private static java.lang.String[] getInputs​(java.lang.String[] input, int requiredInputNum, java.util.Scanner myScanner)
      Helper method for run(). Prompts user for input to fill the "A" and "R" commands
      Parameters:
      input - - user provided input from the command line
      requiredInputNum - - the number of parameters required for a GroceryItem
      myScanner - - the Scanner object used to get user input
      Returns:
      a String array containing the 3 required parameters forGroceryItem

    • checkOut

      A method which displays the contents, sales total, sales tax, and total of a given bag.
      Parameters:
      bag - - the back which is being checked out and displayed.

    • quit
